sec.div: Extraction of essential oil from the leaves of L. erythrocarpa
sec.p: The leaves of L. erythrocarpa were collected from Namwon (a region in Jeju Island, Korea) in May 2014 and LEO was extracted by hydrodistillation. Briefly, approximately 300 g of fresh L. erythrocarpa leaves was immersed in 3 l of distilled water in a 5-l flask. Subsequently, the obtained essential oil was dried over anhydrous sodium sulfate, filtered, and stored in a sealed vial at 4 Â°C until tested. The LEO yield was approximately 0.067 % (v/w).
